channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vandalised trees, 29th May
item.description:
All of the saplings on the Henley Road Green have been vandalised..... Ripped up and or broken!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Solway Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree roots outside 72 Milton Road, 29th May

item.title: Water leak, 29th May
item.description:
Water leaking from small square metal plate in road - running straight into adjacent road gully. Lansdown Crescent, a few metres from it's junction with the A40 Lansdown Road - opposite Westal Green filling station. Been leaking constantly for weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Westal Stores Lansdown Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple road surface defect on Fairview Road, 28th May
item.description:
This road has been in this state for nearly 5 years

item.title: Numerous potholes and ridges, 28th May
item.description:
Along most of Prestbury Road there are deep ridges in the centre of the carriageway, numerous potholes across its sides of the road and the added hazard of parked cars along the road, meaning it is impossible to avoid the holes, I am getting so fed up of my car being damaged by the terrible state of the roads in Cheltenham. PLEASE RESURFACE THE WHOLE OF PRESTBURY ROAD from the playing files, just after the new build houses! Is this not what some of the council tax is for???!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 141 Hewlett Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road from Dart Road to end that meets Prestbury Road is full of deep ridges and holes that ay havic with my suspension and tyres, 28th May
item.description:
Been like this for several years and getting worse. No re-surfacing has been done in a long time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 120 Cromwell Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signage required, 27th May
item.description:
Horses and riders use this junction on a regular basis. Currently there is no signage warning of horse riders despite several nasty horse accidents here over the past few years. I had hoped that with all the highways improvements and constant roadworks here that Gloucestershire Highways would have considered properly the use of horse riders.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Corner House A4019, Coombe Hill
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole "filling in", 27th May
item.description:
Abysmal filling in of the pothole. Also, many potholes aren't filled in at all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Workshop Fieldview Bungalow A38, The Leigh

item.title: Extremely overgrown pavement - almost impassable, 27th May
item.description:
The footpath between Stanboro Lane and Knightsbridge Lodge is extremely overgrown in parts (grass and weeds are now above my waist and almost head height in parts) and the reservation in the Stanboro area has very long grass obstructing viewing when pulling out of the junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Stanboro Cottage A4019, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 Welland Drive, Cheltenham

item.title: Eggy smell rushing water, 26th May
item.description:
I noticed a loud sound of rushing water under the manhole covers, there is also an eggy/drainy smell along Quat Goose Lane towards The Firs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Willow Lodge Brockhampton Lane, Swindon Village
